verses.roman:
"sanātana, tumi yāvat kāśīte rahibā
tāvat āmāra ghare bhikṣā ye karibā"

synonyms: sanātana—O Sanātana; tumi—you; yāvat—as long as; kāśīte—in Benares; rahibā—will remain; tāvat—so long; āmāra—my; ghare—at the home; bhikṣā—lunch; ye—that; karibā—please accept.
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "My dear Sanātana, as long as you remain at Kāśī, please accept lunch at my place."
